website_summaries.verdict: This pair tops the pack for budget-conscious shoppers, thanks to the affordable price and money-back guarantee. Though they won't work for everyone, they are a great deal for those who can wear them.
pros: An inexpensive pair with comfortable wool-like lining
Comes in several fashionable colors and sizes for both men and women
Backed by an impressive money back guarantee
cons: A few consumers complain that the touchscreen fingers aren't compatible with all devices, but the guarantee provides peace of mind if they don't work for you

customer_reviews.title: If you want beef then BRING DA RUCKUS
customer_reviews.text: If like me you are a huge Wu Tang fan, but struggle to keep your hands warm when throwing your “W” up during the cold winter months, your search for the perfect gloves is now over. I have searched far and wide for a glove which provides both warmth, and allows for the right amount of dexterity required for the physical manifestation of the Wu Tang logo. Most manufacturers fail to even mention the capability of their gloves in this regard, so imagine my joy when I saw from the product image that these gloves were specifically designed with the discerning Clan member in mind. Suuuuuuuuu
customer_reviews.author: Erica Ivy

customer_reviews.title: Nice long fingers!
customer_reviews.text: I have really long fingers, and finding warm gloves that aren't ridiculously loose is a problem I've had my whole life. These gloves are quite warm (i have used them in weather as cold as about 20F), super soft on the inside, and even with my long nails, they don't make me feel like I've got webbing between my fingers! And the little rubber grip dots go almost to the tips of each finger, so they're great for driving, playing on my phone without dropping it, and anything else I need to do.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Mulligan

customer_reviews.title: cute, warm, reasonably priced, and actually work with touch screens!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these gloves because I am a college student in Michigan. The winters are brutal and I usually talk on the phone while I walk to and from class. On really cold days (which are most days in the winter here) my hands ache while holding my phone as I walk to and from classes on campus. I couldn't wear regular mittens because it defeated the purpose when I had to use my touch screen phone. I went on amazon and found these gloves. They're so cute and warm and work on my phone, I am thoroughly happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Clair

customer_reviews.title: Stylish gloves
customer_reviews.text: Love the gloves, live in Minneapolis.mn today’s high was 22% and my hands didn’t get to cold 🥶 had my gloves on, and I still can use the functions, on my phone 📲 pretty good grip as well.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin

customer_reviews.title: Gloves are warm!
customer_reviews.text: So I love these gloves! I was kinda bummed when I went to order the “thick” black gloves and they weren’t gonna be available until after I needed them. So I ordered the regular gloves thinking my hands would be a little cold but that’s not the case! They fit so good and are super warm. Only thing is when using the index finger I had to press pretty hard on my screen for it to work but the other fingers work fine. For as much as I paid for these gloves and the amount of time it took to get to me (2 days and I don’t have prime!) I am very happy 🤗
customer_reviews.author: Rashida

customer_reviews.title: Size medium, fits small hands nicely.
customer_reviews.text: I live in AZ, and these are great for cold morning runs, being able to touch tracker on phone without removing gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Lily Lax

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves! When I saw them and put them ...
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves! When I saw them and put them on I was very skeptical that they would work but sure enough they do! I did notice though, that after wearing them for awhile the finger that you use most will lose the effect. But if you switch to a different finger you're back in business. Then when you take them off and put them on later again they work just fine. Does this have to do with body temperature? Not sure....overall though I'm happy with this purchase. Great fit, great price, does what is expected. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: meljoj

customer_reviews.title: Good fit but don’t lasts
customer_reviews.text: Touch screen works great however these gloves are coming apart in less than one weeks use. I’m very disappointed since they fit well but just don’t lasts. Beware
customer_reviews.author: R. Le

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the winter // mind the size tho!
customer_reviews.text: These are really great quality gloves with no loose threads and really great insulation. The size you order does matter I believe as I have very small hands and even on me they were a bit tight. Would definitely purchase another pair!
customer_reviews.author: Sofia

customer_reviews.title: it's just how i saw it in the picture. i like it.  very nice.
customer_reviews.text: At this time of the year it has been very cold compare to other years specially when i go in the morning to drop my son to school. Our hands get very cold that we don't want to take it out from the jacket/sweater but we need to. I when to couple of stores and no one has them anymore so my only option was to order them online. The quality is very good just how i expect it, not only that the price and the shipment very good price and the shipment fast, fantastic. love it... I'm very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Maggy S.

customer_reviews.title: Short cuffs, flat wide fingertips, pretty color.
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are a pretty color and were the right width and length. For me the cuffs were too short - just barely came to the level of my watch - and left my wrists cold. Also, the fingertips were flat and wide, and so when on the gloves looked a little awkward for a human, and looked more like they were made for a tree frog. I returned the gloves.
customer_reviews.author: S. Reid

customer_reviews.title: Not for heavy use.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for use at work. I use a touchscreen inside of a cooler/freezer nearly all day. They were awesome at first but after a couple of weeks they were worn out and no longer worked for the touchscreen. Now I’m back to glove on glove off glove on glove off.
customer_reviews.author: LiveLoveCookBake

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product
customer_reviews.text: Extremely warm. Fingers were a bit snug at first but eventually accommodated my "Lincoln Log" fingers
customer_reviews.author: Kyle S

customer_reviews.title: Lovely Gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are great, they get the job done. Warm and toasty, and the touchscreen works great.
customer_reviews.author: Haley Rickett

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Does not in any shape or form allow you to use the touch screen on your phone. Tried every which way possible and nothing works on either pair I ordered. Too late to get something else in for my trip to Alaska so I will have to suck it up but don't you get suckered into buying these for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie Shields

customer_reviews.title: No good
customer_reviews.text: The description of said product was not even close to what I received. They are very thin and not very durable. It was said to be warm wool gloves. My hands were so cold and painful after first use. Very diappounted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Really cute but the index finger was sewn to the palm.had to cut it.the tip is now misshapen
customer_reviews.author: P A f

customer_reviews.title: Not Touchscreen!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are as warm as I expected. I like the non slip palm. However these are not touchscreen! The merchant offered to refund 40% of the purchase and I’d keep the gloves. What I really wanted was to exchange for another pair if they would guarantee they would be touchscrren. This was the note from seller: Thank you for your letter and we are sorry to take you the trouble. We will control the quality more strictly in mass production later. We have reture you a refund of 40% already. You will receive it after 2 working days. Sorry again So my advice is if you really want touchscreen do not purchase this item.
customer_reviews.author: Nana B

customer_reviews.title: I Wish They Warmer But They Do The Trick!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a medium pair as I have small hands and they fit well...like a glove. They coulda been a little bigger so I decided to buy a large and give my wife the medium. So obviously I'm good with them. They work pretty easily. I walk regularly at a quick pace for over an hour for exercise so getting my phone out and using it quickly to change my music or look at texts is important. The only drawback is I wish they were warmer. I have been walking in 40 degree weather and I have to ball my hands up to keep them warm or warmer. Still, I'm happy with the product. Especially at $9.99 and Prime!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Not as described!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are nothing as described by seller. No touchscreen at all, but they ripped after being worn 3 times, and now I can use my phone bc of the holes on the top mof my fingers. Do not waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Iskra Kamboures

customer_reviews.title: ... got these for my boyfriend and they fit him great. However the only problem is with the touchscreen
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my boyfriend and they fit him great. However the only problem is with the touchscreen. For some reason he can work his phone with one glove, but if he clicks something with the other it does not work.
customer_reviews.author: cartoonglovette

customer_reviews.title: Cozy but not as touchscreen sensitive as I’d hoped
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are nice and soft, super cozy on the inside. I bought them specifically for the touchscreen ability, but struggle to get it to work. I have really small hands and I got the women’s small, but the only time I can get the touchscreen fingertips to work is if I pull the glove super tight and use a lot of pressure on the pad of my finger. Really, first world problems, and otherwise they’re good gloves for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these gloves but just like all the other reviews they are not worth it. I thought since i was only getting them to wear randomly when we would go out to dinner they would be fine but they do not keep your hands warm at all. Also i haven't even had them that long and there is already a hole at the tip of the index finger. Very disappointing especially when they are pretty thick, you would think they would be warmer
customer_reviews.author: Tsparks31

customer_reviews.title: Not good for cell phone use.
customer_reviews.text: Received these in good time and in good condition. I'm giving it 3 stars because they are very soft, thick and comfy. They do keep my hands warm. However, they do not do what the manufacturer claims. I tried using these to work my cell phone and they do not activate the screen without having to take them off which was the whole reason for purchasing them in the first place. I could scroll with them but that's it. Could not text or select things on the phone. Would not recommend as a glove that works with the phone. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: HauntedChicken

customer_reviews.title: Overall ok
customer_reviews.text: They effectively allow me to use my touch screen. Their description is not totally true. I will go point by point. Touchscreen: Yes Warm? Not really. Thermal soft. Not. Elastic? yes. Anti-slip: yes Size: L worked for me although according to the table I'm M. Beware. Consider one size over your actual measurement.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Torres

customer_reviews.title: Warm and cozy, but touch screen fingers don't work
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are great for keeping my hands warm, the lining is really comfortable on my hands. Unfortunately the touch screen fingers do not work at all. But I like the warmth of the gloves so much that I may give this pair to my mom and try another pair. My sister has a pair (but I have the thicker black ones and she has the regular black ones) and her touch screen fingers work just fine. Also, they are just a tad snug around the wrists, but I usually only feel it for the first few seconds that I have them on, then I don't notice it.
customer_reviews.author: Lovely

customer_reviews.title: The sizing of these gloves are ridiciously small even their large size!!! Do not buy them!
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea how this company can claim that they sell gloves of any size other than small. I ordered size: Large and I can barely get my hand in the glove and it's very tight. Do not purchase gloves from this company unless you are planning on giving the gloves to a 5-year-old!
customer_reviews.author: OPH

customer_reviews.title: Toasty Digits
customer_reviews.text: After tearing my house apart in a effort to find at least one pair of gloves I already own, and failing miserably, it was time to get a new pair. Never have I been so happy to have to replace an item. These Achiou winter knit gloves are easily better than any I've owned. Comfy and snug to the extreme as well as cute as all get out. I've been wearing them non-stop, even in the cold of my workplace. The touchscreen capability is an added bonus. Highly recommend these gloves. Planning on getting a backup pair for when I inevitably lose these.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly M. Cox

customer_reviews.title: BE AWARE:  Return shipping cost is high
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to see if it fit better than the smaller size I had already purchased, and planned to return the one didn’t fit as well. It turned out that the one I bought earlier was a better fit. In attempting to return this item, I found that I was going to be charged more than half the cost of the item for return shipping. I decided just to give the gloves away as it was not worth it to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Hunakai

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably priced and comfortable gloves
customer_reviews.text: The touch screen tips on both finger and thumb are very useful. I have smaller sized hands and type using my thumb most of the time. No extra finger tip length issues I usually have with most gloves. The grips are nice for having an extra hold for driving. Warm enough for temperature like in the 30s but if you live in the Midwest where it drops to negative temperatures this glove isn't rated for that type of cold weather. Overall good glove for fit, price, and touch screen ability.
customer_reviews.author: Vhtien86

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what size I was sent, but it was not the expected size and was too small
customer_reviews.text: These look and feel nice, BUT, they are way too small. I noted and followed the measurements on the website which agrees with the size I normally wear, but these were at least a size too small. Of more concern is that neither the gloves themselves NOR the packaging indicated the size (I thought I might have been sent a Medium rather than a large.) It makes you question how Amazon can determine which product to send? There is a product code (X001NH6W9D) as well as two Chinese characters, neither of which provided a clue if the proper size was even sent to me. I have returned and order another brand....
customer_reviews.author: Ownid

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, warm, well-fitting gloves
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband, after he lost yet another (half) pair of gloves. I was really happy with how much he likes these. He says they are the best gloves he has had. He hasn't had to wear them in terribly cold or wet weather, about low to mid 40's F. My husband doesn't really use a cell phone or other electronic device while wearing these gloves, but they worked when I tested them myself. They fit his hands and keep them warm - 2 key things that I need gloves to do for him! They are flexible enough that he can manipulate doorknobs, leashes, and tissues wearing the gloves. Yay! Good job, Achiou!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth M.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on touchscreen
customer_reviews.text: Boooo! I need 4 thumbs so I can give these whack gloves 4 thumbs down. I have these things on right now and NO THEY DO NOT WORK on any touch screens. I look like a dork smacking my phone in the airport and yelling “why aren’t you working!”. Thanks Actchu! They’re super thin and I can see my skin as soon as I put them on. They made a food Actcha me. Whack!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Shame on paid reviews

customer_reviews.title: I can work on my laptop Key board too, and they work on the touchscreen, swipe and text
customer_reviews.text: Now for texting I swipe so that actually works better than bare finger swiping!. That amazed me. the thumb is fatter for for those thumb using texters, but with some practice i mastered that too. I purchased these as my right hand tends to get cold INSIDE the house and i needed to work so figured to try was worth it for this IS GREAT value. But i'll gladly take them out too now. I would handwash them only in cold water don't wring them, let them dry flat. like good sweaters. or buy more ;) love the choclate color too. Remember dont text and drive!
customer_reviews.author: Gina C.

customer_reviews.title: Not Touch Sensitive...For Long
customer_reviews.text: The touch sensitivity occasionally functional at first, soon faded. While I bought them for this feature and thought I'd give them a second shot exchanging my first pair, the second pair was just as wonky. I've decided to keep both pairs. At less than $10, they are still warm, comfortable and provide a good fit for both my girlfriend and myself. I'm now looking for some gloves that actually work with my devices.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Scarface

customer_reviews.title: Too tight for me, Raynauds attack
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tried these out very much yet because they feel too small. I got a size small because I guess I just assumed I have small hands as I am a small woman and have never been told otherwise. I didn't do any measurements so maybe it's my fault but they feel too tight on my fingers, like they're compressing them. I have Raynaud's and anything too tight on my fingers causes a Raynauds attack. Therefore, I don't think these work for me well. That being said, I haven't returned them yet as I hate dealing with returns so I may just try them out a little more. But so far, they're too tight.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica E.

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are a "glorified" version of the dollar store gloves I bought for my kids when they were little. They are stretchy and would fit a variety of hand sizes, but they do not offer a lot of warmth. They were described as "wool lined" and if there's any wool at all, it is weaved into the product. The touch screen aspect didn't initially work, and I had to take the gloves off to use my phone. Sometimes it works, sometimes not. Theses are gloves for a child, not an adult trying to keep their hands warm and use their phone or any touch screen at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Adamson

customer_reviews.title: You really can use your cellphone in these comfortable, tight-fitting gloves
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, tight-fitting gloves for those of us who live in locations where the brutal winter weather is not really all that brutal. And you really can operate a touchscreen phone and home security system while wearing said gloves. They are comfortable and keep your hands warm when the temperatures are in the 30s. Would they keep your hands warm when the temps drop below freezing? I'll know when that happens, if that happens this winter. (It doesn't happen every winter in Las Vegas.) But you can't operate a cell phone while wearing big ol' ski gloves.
customer_reviews.author: R. P. Spretnak

customer_reviews.title: They work better than expected.  Grips are nice for steering wheel.
customer_reviews.text: They work surprisingly well, but at the end of the day you still have a thick glove on, so it’s not perfect, but better than I expected, and recommended. Be nice if there was a tiny spot at the tip of the index fingers for more precise typing, but again they do surprisingly well as-is. The grip is nice on the steering wheel. Only complaint is they seem to run a little smaller than I expected (large men’s). Specifically, they don’t go as far up the wrist as I expected. Should have gotten an XL, just worried that touchscreen performance would suffer.
customer_reviews.author: reako

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are soft, comfortable and the touch screen parts work well. The only reason I gave a four star review is because they do not keep my fingers warm. That is really not the fault of the gloves. It is because I have Raynaud's Phenomenon. That means that when my hands get cold, I lose the blood in my fingers. I bought these gloves hoping that they would work. I have tried everything! Anyone that doesn't have this phenomenon would love the gloves!
customer_reviews.author: mw

customer_reviews.title: Some gloves have different lengths for fingers despite the same size.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: These gloves are soft and the cloth feels sturdy and thick. It has touchscreen capabilities. Cons: Different colored gloves have different finger lengths despite being the same size. Touch screen capabilities diminish if gloves don't fit well. I first bought a grey pair (size M) and they fit perfectly so I went and bought a black pair. After asking for a replacement, I've realized the black ones just don't fit right. The gloves' thumb and picky are much longer. The black ones are better for people with a long pinky and thumb. Looks like I'll stick with just the grey ones.
customer_reviews.author: curveballamu

customer_reviews.title: Touch capability gone in a few days
customer_reviews.text: It got 2 stars because of good customer support. 2 of the fingers on the right glove came with good sized pulls. I sent pictures, they refunded me. However, after a few days of use, the touch function barely registers on my cell phone. I bought medium, and most gloves fit well; these run somewhat small. They are soft, but not very warm. I would not purchase these again. Update: A few days later and that middle finger pull is now a hole :(
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Gorga

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: I was some what disappointed in these. They replaced an old (10 years) pair of Reebok running gloves and maybe unfair but no comparisons. I equate these to a higher version of the knit type gloves with the little nubs you buy at dollar stores. Fit is good, just do not think they will last for me. Okay in temps at best high 20's, low 30's. If you are looking for substantial gloves these are not them. I am afraid I will snag the material and they will run easily but we shall see. I bought a pair for my wife and she is a little easier on them than me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Totally worthless
customer_reviews.text: If you’re looking for gloves that transfer your body heat to your iPhone so that you can operate it with the gloves on, forget it. These are utterly worthless. You can do better if you are just looking for warm gloves by looking at the plethora of other choices since not only will they keep you warmer they will wear longer. After only a month of casual use these are also Falling apart! If you do need gloves that can work with your iPhone go to the many other options. But stay away from these worthless badly constructed items.
customer_reviews.author: Julius Forte

customer_reviews.title: Updated review: touchscreen doesn't work after short usr
customer_reviews.text: These are nice gloves. I bought them originally in a large but they seemed a bit small... just too close fit on my fingers and not far enough down my wrist. The XL that's pictured here fits better but a tiny bit big. The touchscreen works great and they are nice and warm. Overall, I think they're worth it especially for the price. UPDATE: So after using these for about 2 weeks, the touchscreen part of the gloves don't work. So you're stuck having to take the gloves off to use your phone. I could've just used my old gloves for that. The whole reason I bought these was for the touchscreen. Don't bother buying.
customer_reviews.author: Wonder_Mom

customer_reviews.title: Soft, cozy, perfect for the cold
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are great. Fit perfect at a medium, right to wrist, very soft inside. Outside has a perfect pattern of small grip pads to ensure a good grip in the cold weather. The 3 fingers work perfectly for use on my phone and tablet so I don't have to be exposed to the cold to send a message or answer the phone. They are a very good quality, great build and feel perfect wearing. Highly recommend them to all. Be sure to check your size as they indicated. I measured, fit within the Medium, and it was a perfect match.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn S

customer_reviews.title: BEST gloves ever
customer_reviews.text: I'm the type of person that gets news gloves every year because I have no idea where they go when they are no longer needed. Plus to be honest those gloves were never warm enough. These gloves are AWESOME. I love them and I will never lose them. They are inlined with thermal, I consider it to be fleece material. I can't say if the touchscreen part works because my phone sucks and doesn't like anybody, but I got these gloves to keep my hands warm not to play on my phone. So I am very very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: GREAT WIsconsin Gloves
customer_reviews.text: i love these and will be buying more. they are 10x better than the cheap cotton gloves we all buy in the supermarket. i have worn these every cold day since I got them and not once had to wish for a heavier glove. i'm sure the day will come but...it IS Wisconsin after all, but so far so good for me. Nice quality, I washed them and forgot they were there and tossed them in the dryer. they did not shrink an iota.. really nice. i will be ordering more on pay day.
customer_reviews.author: Cyberwolf

customer_reviews.title: Really nice gloves!
customer_reviews.text: It's only September and my hands are already cold in the house so I thought I'd give these a try. They are really soft and feel thick without being bulky. They are snug but not tight so they feel very comfortable and warm. (I am a woman with pretty small hands and the medium size was perfect.) The rubber grips are really helpful, allowing me to do household chores with them on without them being slippery. If you have Raynaud's disease like me, or just constantly cold hands, I think you will find these very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: sleew21

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are pretty bad, at least the "thicker" dual lining ones. They're measuring the length from the bottom of your palm to the top of the your middle finger, needless to say they do not fit very well. The dual lining isn't fixed with the outer lining so as a result every time you take them off the inner lining inverts and doesn't go back into place. And even when they are properly aligned they're not very good at retaining heat. Save your money and look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Darn Good
customer_reviews.text: I'm currently wearing these for the first time, and I gotta say I'm impressed. My office at work gets so cold, my fingers are frequently going numb, and these gloves are helping a lot. Pretty warm, considering they are not very thick. Just sent a few texts on my phone and the touch fingers work well on my phone screen. I'm even able to type reasonably well on my desktop keyboard while wearing these gloves. It's not ideal as I can't feel the keys very well, but I'm getting it done OK. Anyway, so far I'm fairly impressed with these gloves. No reason to take off any stars, but I'll update this review if anything comes up.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrod M.

customer_reviews.title: Coolness
customer_reviews.text: I use these when running, and doing calisthenics in the morning. I haven't worn them in the rain yet, but they seem to accept sweat well enough - not becoming too heavy. If you've used cotton gloves, then this difference should be clear. Warmth is good enough, but I don't wear them in winter, just in morning coolness. I don't really care about the touch screen ability, but it is able to do that. The nonslip grip is useful for pullups. All in all, good gloves at a good price. Will definitely pick up more.
customer_reviews.author: awakeneddragonTop Contributor: Anime

customer_reviews.title: Donot buy
customer_reviews.text: Worst gloves that I have ever bought ! They are so thin, that my nails poke out of the gloves(my nails are not even long). And it is not keeping my hands warm. I am freezing with these gloves!
customer_reviews.author: Sd

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves to wear to an all day outside event when the weather was not going to be friendly; it was COLD!! But I also knew I needed to keep in touch with my Mom who was watching my kids. I didn't want to have to keep taking my gloves off and on every time I needed to use my phone to text. These gloves were absolutely amazing. They kept my hands from freezing in 30-40* weather and worked wonderfully for me to text on my phone with no problems. I highly recommend these gloves. They are stylish but functional as well.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: One of the better touch-screen gloves I've owned.
customer_reviews.text: This is certainly one of the better touch-screen gloves, much more responsive than others and it's nice to have the rubber spots to add more grip without them getting stuck in my hand. Allows a secure hold with movement. Snug fit and my partner enjoys his and found them very warm and we've had (real feel of 8/F). The glove matches my blue jacket IDENTICALLY, which turned out to be a nice plus. Haven't had a chance to test water resistance as I haven't worn it in wet nor snowy weather yet. It's as soft as expected so wasn't giving it 5 stars, just 4.
customer_reviews.author: AvCheu

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend these gloves (with one caveat)
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, in heavy rain these gloves let the cold rain right through them. That's sad because other than this I was quite impressed with the gloves. I was able to operate the touch screen on my phone just as easily as if my fingers had been bare. The fit is perfect. The gloves keep my hands warm. I was pleasantly surprised to discover that the gloves keep my hands warm even in a strong, cold, wind. The dexterity that is possible when wearing the gloves amazed me.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: These gloves seem to be very well made and I'm going to keep them. First pair was medium and very tight. I returned and ordered large, still snug but better. I don't believe a man could wear these unless they had small hands. As far as warmth, won't know until December but hoping they will do the trick. They do fit like a second skin.
customer_reviews.author: floridonna

customer_reviews.title: Very nice fit if you have very long fingers!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a female mail carrier, with very long fingers. Most gloves don’t fit properly, so I was hesitant to order some without having the chance to try them on and see if they fit all the way down my fingers to my knuckles. I’m glad I got them. The fit perfectly! They’re snug, warm, and have grips on the palms so that I can hold my mail without having it slip out of my hands. I like being able to use my phone without removing my gloves too. Now I can work without my hands freezing!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Whitney

customer_reviews.title: These gloves really work.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several gloves that proclaim to allow you to be able to use your cellphone touch screen and they didn't work. However, these do. I have not washed them but have worn them quite a bit and have had no problems with using my cellphone. I also bought the thinner ones from this company and they work also without the thickness of these gloves. I needed a pair for when it is really cold (these) and a pair for when it is cool but not extreme cold. Love these and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: 100% unusable (at least my pair is)
customer_reviews.text: Gloves are nice from fit and appearance perspectives. The black grip parts on the palm though are almost tar-like in spots. They rub off onto the skin or clothes causing a great deal of problems. Hopefully I just got a one-off but these gloves are 100% unusable. Promptly returned and never even tried to use. Unfortunate.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Order a Larger size than Usual
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size medium in all gloves I purchase cause I have short stubby fingers and wide hands. I ordered medium and they are far to small for me. I should of ordered a Large or bigger or even a different brand. The gloves are not as soft as I was hoping for, but do allow for texting and using my smart phone.
customer_reviews.author: Wildlifer

customer_reviews.title: Lay off the guilt trip
customer_reviews.text: I received an email today asking for a review on this product. Here's the first sentence: "I'm Lucy, As a small enterprise team and a working hard mom, my 4-year-old daughter Judy and I are appreciated that your choice our products, which you bought earlier." The gloves are fine, but I really don't think this product with over 10,000 ratings was made by a "small enterprise team" and I strongly doubt "Lucy and her 4 year old daughter" had anything to do with their production. Don't guilt trip customers to get a good review. Just be honest.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle W.

customer_reviews.title: Much needed here in Alaska
customer_reviews.text: Having had it grow thin on the need to peel off my winter gloves to utilize the touchscreen when I needed to use the phone or snap a photo while walking the dog on frigid days, I was looking forward to getting these gloves. I'm happy to say they work well and provide good warmth for my hands. Heck, they even seem to have survived the ample dog hair my corgi mix has managed to shed onto them in the process of getting ready for and then walking. I won't hesitate to buy again.
customer_reviews.author: June Price

customer_reviews.title: It works, but awkwardly
customer_reviews.text: It works, but awkwardly. the meaning of the word, “works”, is that it does allow you to have your device respond to your actions; however, it is very awkward when you’re trying to do that: you cannot type while wearing these gloves, because I’m using iPhone 6s and the bottoms are too small for typing. As a result, when you were trying to click it, it was always land on another bottom that’s adjacent to the intended one, so that you can’t really type, which is what you wanna do in the first place. so it works, but really awkward. so I’m not giving it one star, which means that doesn’t work, I’m giving it 2: it works, but awkwardly.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymity

customer_reviews.title: Available size options are not accurate
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a medium pair of these gloves and I am returning them because they are too small for my hands. Now, I'm not the biggest guy nor do I have enormous hands. They're pretty average and I would've expected medium to perfectly fit me. Unfortunately, they did not. The gloves fit but they were extremely uncomfortable even after wearing them for a few minutes. If you are planning on getting these gloves, get a size higher just to be safe.
customer_reviews.author: Shadowmalice89

customer_reviews.title: Good for moderate cold conditions and great touch function.
customer_reviews.text: Wore these while biking in chilly weather, kept my hands very comfortable. The touch screen function worked awesome for me. I really only used them for touch screen purposes while taking pictures so I am unsure how it would be for texting. However I have zero issues taking pictures and maneuvering my phone to get to the camera, so I am assuming texting would be easy. They formed very well to my hands and were not bulky. The gloves are pretty soft and would be good for keeping your hands moderately warm, although not in extreme cold conditions.
customer_reviews.author: audreyloverunning17

customer_reviews.title: Day to day glove
customer_reviews.text: These are nice gloves. They aren’t water resistant as I’ve been out several times snow blowing and shivering and still have wet hands. I’ve gone to wearing my kids snow gloves for such events now. They are soft and the grip hands are nice for steering wheel usage. They are warm for walking to a from car, and in a cold car. They are thicker than most cotton gloves. I do have trouble with the touch screen finger tips most times so I have to take one off to proceed with texting or in car touch screening. Over all a warm glove for day to day living.
customer_reviews.author: ChristieM

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, slightly small, needed patching to start with
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are quite comfortable, very grippy for woolen gloves as they have some gel pattern on the palm side, and the touch-screen function works remarkably well. I did have a hole due to improperly finished mounting of the glove parts, but a thread and a needle took care of that with no ado - I dropped a star for that, yet considering the price they are quite nice. Last detail, my hands are slightly less than eight inches around the knuckles and these gloves are a little too small for me.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Perdu

customer_reviews.title: Gloves kept my hands warm and I was able to use  my devices.
customer_reviews.text: These are attractive and comfortable gloves, and they come in a nice plastic zipper case, which makes it easy to store them flat in a purse or backpack. I used them during my trip to Norway and they were great, although the more extreme cold of the North Cape (Arctic region) my hands got a little cold, but if I was there for a real long period of time I would have used more insulated gloves. These kept my hands warm enough that they did not turn blue. Overall all I am happy with the gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline M. Butts

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are truly fantastic particularly for the price. They are snug, toasty, and the touch screen feature actually WORKS. Really great gloves for the price. We got the ones with extra lining- they do run a little small so I'd recommend sizing up- I have very small hands and I went with a medium, and my husband has normal sized and we got a large and we are glad. Can't say enough good things about them. Heading to buy a second pair right now in fact!
customer_reviews.author: Robin Gallant

customer_reviews.title: Very warm and the touch feature works well. The logo looks tacky.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how long the touch surface will last with use but for now, it does very well. I got a black pair for myself and a raglan knit for my daughter. I have long fingers and the large glove works well. They lost a point for the tacky brand name going down the side. They will be good for shoveling and other outdoor activities. They are too slippery to make good driving gloves and are definitely not stylish. I wouldn't wear them to anyplace I want to look nice.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Great during cold weather with a Phone!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these as an XMas gift for my mother-in-law. She goes on some weird "adventures" haha, so we tend to worry if we don't hear back from her. She has major sensitivity to the cold, so a lightbulb popped in my head "...she's not responding because she doesn't want to take her gloves off." She loves them, haven't seen her without them. Oh and they're "her colors". Worth it **The gloves will take a second to get used to. You just have to fit it right and you're good.
customer_reviews.author: Skittle

customer_reviews.title: What a great pair of gloves.
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised when I got them. I've got two meat hooks on the ends of my arms and I saw the gloves and thought it was an OJ Simpson's situation. But, to my surprise and pleasure, the gloves slipped right on and fit great. Living in Miami I haven't much use, but I've needed them twice since I got them. The non-slip material is great too. I notice that the gloves are ambidextrous. So if I don't want the non-slip surface, I just swap the gloves. Freakin' brilliant! I'll tell everyone I know that needs them to get your product!
customer_reviews.author: Big0725

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves for all but the coldest weather
customer_reviews.text: I wear these gloves when I walk my dog on winter mornings and evenings in the Northeast US. They are perfect for all but the coldest days and give me adequate dexterity to deploy, use, and tie dog refuse bags. The cell-phone feature works and allows me to use my phone without removing them. They are not water resistant and I would not wear them below 20 degrees F when only walking. They run a little small therefore I'd recommend going a size up.
customer_reviews.author: Pleasant Valley Sunday

customer_reviews.title: Vert thick cheap kids type gloves, don't work on touchscreen
customer_reviews.text: These r like the kids gloves my Mom would buy me as a kid fr K-mart yrs ago. They wear out fast n don't keep ur hands warm. I measured my hand 2b sure on size, n still very tight. In my vehicle it's very hard 2 touch my NAV Screen w/o hitting the wrong button. The included note was cute, but if ur selling a product, spare the story by trying 2 Guilt us in2 not returning a poor product. 4the low cost of the gloves I will probably just giv 2 Grandkid in Lu of returning, but not buying again
customer_reviews.author: lefty

customer_reviews.title: Touch screen does not work
customer_reviews.text: Giving these gloves 3 stars because when I wear them I cannot access my smartphone touch screen and that is a main reason why I brought these gloves so that I could wear them and still be on my phone. I work in a really cold office so I like to wear these gloves but my work computer is touch screen so I cannot access everything without having to take off the gloves. Three stars because I like the design and the fit and they keep my hands decently warm.
customer_reviews.author: Bria

customer_reviews.title: Cell Phone compatible gloves
customer_reviews.text: Hey! I tried my Achiou gloves on my cell phone today. You can use a cell phone with the gloves on. I can actually text with the gloves on. They are moderately thick, but not clumsy. I like the silicon decals stuck to the palm side of the glove. The elastic in the cuff is comfortable. My hands are average for a woman. I'm sure a lot of women would need the larger size. I wish the cuff would extend a little higher up the arm for warmth.
customer_reviews.author: CHUBBY

customer_reviews.title: Great for driving. Can type on the key board and  use touch screen while wearing them.
customer_reviews.text: It keep my hands warm. it is not water proof. I can type on the key board and use the touch screen computer while wearing them. I would not wear them to do garden work or working on the car. It has the non slip palm. It can be wear with the right side up, no slip stuff, on the top of your hand. The knitting is tight and soft. The cuff is tight and keep the gloves on the hand. They are very comfortable. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: Bear Creek

customer_reviews.title: Good size, and fit but are not warm
customer_reviews.text: These are one of the best fitting gloves I have ever worn (I used their sizing chart to determine my size), and the screen touch section of the gloves work great on my phone. However, they are in no means winter gloves. They keep the water out to some degree, but they are not warm in the slightest. Also, the grips along the fingertips have completely worn off in two weeks of standard use. I did not use these in any rugged conditions, and I can say that they don't serve well as a winter glove at least not in New York State.
customer_reviews.author: Mike & Sam

customer_reviews.title: Nice but not super warm
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a pair of large/blue, that arrived quickly (yesterday). These were to replace my Isotoners. I like my Isotoners but they were not warm enough for skiing. These gloves fit nicely and seemed warmer. I tried to use them while using a snow blower (4 degrees, with a wind chill of -14). I did not last 7 minutes. My fingers went numb and had to go inside to treat them to prevent frostbite damage. When I took the gloves off my fingers were blue! This was from the dye. I plan to still use the gloves for cold/non-snow weather, never below 33 degree.

customer_reviews.title: Not very effective
customer_reviews.text: Bought these gloves on the off chance that it snowed while I was away. Day 1 I forgot that I had them, day 2 I wore them and my hands were still cold. It was as if I had nothing on. The touch screen fingers weren't very good at all, even when I adjust the fingers to be firmly at the tip of the glove it didn't respond 50% of the time. Missed a bunch of pictures, ended up just taking off the glove to use my phone. Temperature wise, there was no difference.
customer_reviews.author: K Fish

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and keeps hands warm
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to play tennis with. I play throughout the winter in southern California and some nights get quite cold. I am able to use these gloves on my non-raquet hand to keep it warm and it does a good job. The gloves are a very nice colour and they fit snugly but not too tightly. I definitely recommend them. I have not tried the touch-screen aspect because I don't really need to use a touch screen while I play tennis. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and fits well
customer_reviews.text: I can't rank their usefulness with a touch screen yet, because it's 80F where I live . But I bought these in advance of a trip I'm taking in January. I think they will be great. I wanted a pair of gloves that would be warm but also not too expensive in case I lose them (I always lose a glove!). The touch-screen capability seems interesting; hopefully it works well because I know I'll be using my phone a lot. TL;DR a well-fitting glove at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn C Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Great Driving Gloves
customer_reviews.text: As someone with Raynaud's Syndrome, it is important to keep my fingers warm. These gloves do the trick! My fingers stay toasty and the gloves are comfortable. The gripping surface works very well for driving. My daughter lost one of my gloves while skating and I bought another pair because these are the best I have found. If you are doing activities where the gloves will get wet they will not work, but otherwise they are fabulous.
customer_reviews.author: B. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: For the price, they exceed expectations
customer_reviews.text: I love them so much I bought 4 pairs. One for each coat. They are so comfortable, warm, and the touch screen works great. I've surprisingly gotten compliments on them (I mean who gets compliments on their gloves?). If I'm cleaning snow off my car they do stay dry, but picking up snow for snowballs they will end up getting your hands a little wet. So water resistant not waterproof - but I didn't even know it was water resistant to begin with so I was nicely surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha P

customer_reviews.title: A bit disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Gloves fits nice but not very warm. The touch screen also is very tricky. Doesn’t work most lof the time, you’ll have to play with the angles of your finger.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Were comfy and grippy, but fell apart.
customer_reviews.text: I really really liked these gloves when I got them. Had i not waited it out this would have been a 5 star review. Instead I decided to see how they wore before reviewing. Sure enough the ends of them (fingertips) have started to come apart. Now I have some fingertips that just poke right out of the top of them. This is really unfortunate because they were just the right amount of warm, and the gripping material on them is just fantastic for dog walking or gripping you car steering wheel. Long story short if you want some grippy open fingertip gloves give these a try. Otherwise gotta go for something higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: Hag

customer_reviews.title: These are VERY small gloves
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size Large, which should have been the correct size according to the dimensions listed. They fit all right around the palm of my hand, but the fingers are so tight that I almost couldn't bend my fingers. My husband has smaller hands than I do, and he also found them too tight. The touch screen feature worked fine -- I tried them out while I was deciding whether to return them -- but it just wasn't worth it to keep them. Order at least one size up!
customer_reviews.author: aeryncrichton

customer_reviews.title: Probably good for moderate winter weather
customer_reviews.text: We are having a cold snap here and it's been about 12-14 degrees Fahrenheit. I ordered these gloves to replace the cheap box store gloves I've been wearing. Sadly, the cold wind blows right through them and it basically felt like I didn't have any protection at all. They are stylish and they look nice on my hands. Feel good, too. Maybe in a more temperate temperature, they would be good but they are definitely not made for super cold. I went back to my cheap box store gloves for the time being.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Burnett

customer_reviews.title: Very solid product.
customer_reviews.text: Very interesting gloves.Much thicker than i expected. Fit very small. I have cold hands all year round due to neuropathy, those gloves make them very comftable and i dont need to take them off if i answer or use the cell phone. Work great. It had a little card w it, talking about the mother/young daughter team that sold those gloves. I thought that was nice, young Entrepeneurs. If they werent so small id buy another pair.My hands are small, i was more worried they be too big like most others. Im just glad they arrived so fast. No more pain, i even wore them to bed.
customer_reviews.author: VA-TX1995

customer_reviews.title: A TRUE BLESSING!!!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are ABSOLUTELY amazing and WARM!!! I work in a refrigerated warehouse (Hello Fresh) and I’ve been trying different gloves for months to keep my hands warm at work with no luck until I found these blessings on Amazon!!! My fiancé was searching relentlessly with me as well because I always complain about my cold hands. Thanks God for the makers of these gloves because they are truly a God send and a blessing to me! I also gifted my coworker with the blue pair that I ordered and she was ecstatic!!!
customer_reviews.author: Aretha Steel

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Was really excited about these gloves. And then I got them. They unfortunately do a next to nonexistent job at capturing touchscreen capabilities on the fingertips of the gloves, and somehow do a better job of retaining cold than warmth. I live in DC, which is not that cold. I take public transportation, and find my hands warm up quicker after taking the gloves off on the bus. They’re soft and cheap. But I can’t say I’d recommend them
customer_reviews.author: mghani

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as they let on
customer_reviews.text: Sadly these gloves do not keep my hands warm when I’m outside doing the 20 min pre trip on my bus. They are warmer then none at all, but I missed my return window by a week so I’m stuck with them. The Ability to use my touch Screen is hit or miss (Not a major deal for me). If the glove isn’t connecting a specific way it won’t work. I will have to find a way to to enhance keeping my hands warm as they’re used heavily through winter routes.
customer_reviews.author: Sean & Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and grip. Touch screen friendly. 👍
customer_reviews.text: Great for what they are, a thinner glove that will protect you to a particular temperature. They are fitting and not cumbersome. One side has the logo and circulars in the palm area to help w grip in driving or holding items. Very helpful. However if it’s 5 degreees or below zero I’m not thinking this would be as helpful at staying warm. I would buy again. And would recommend. And would give as a gift. 👍
customer_reviews.author: E. Jankowski

customer_reviews.title: Not good for the cold
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good as a liner, but wouldn’t recommend as a main glove, especially for any weather under 40F. These are perfect to wear under your real gloves. The rubber grip is very good, though. The touchscreen feature is alright - it works, but nothing is better than your bare finger) Also - if you’re a guy, you’ll probably need the XL size. I got the large, and they were way too small on me - so I gave them to my mom. Anyone with a middle finger 3.0in and above should get the XL - as pictured.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Sizing
customer_reviews.text: I really like these gloves. My only question or complaint is that they fit really tight. I measured my hand as was instructed and ordered the 'Medium" gloves for men. They do fit very tightly and I need to remove them periodically to allow my hands a brief rest. I'm not sure if the problem is if the same sizing is used for men and women or that they are made very snug. At any rate I may have needed a "Large" size.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro J. Ferreyra

customer_reviews.title: Need a warm glove?  Keep looking, these are a spring/ fall glove.
customer_reviews.text: Start with the positive... end with the negative. These gloves are comfortable! The grips on the hands work great. I'm looking forward to wearing these in the spring and fall. However, they are not very warm. I didn't go into the purchase of these glove with the idea i'd be able to wear them in the snow. However, I'd hoped they would keep my hand warm while driving. They don't. The material is very breathable, breathable to the point where I feel cold air coming through them. All in all they'll make a great glove in... not winter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The gloves run very small
customer_reviews.text: I bought them because they had a low price. However, when they arrived the fit was very tight. I purchased a size extra large, but they fight tight. they feel warm , but not cold yet to rate. They are not water proof at all !!!!!!! The touch screen feature is not on the tip of finger , but after the first digit of your hand. I cannot use them to send a text. I guess for 6 bucks they are ok , but I am looking for real cold weather gloves these are not wha I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Glove material is great quality, definitely keeps hands warm enough. The added grip on the palms is nice and beneficial. As far as the touch screen aspect, it's mediocre. Though these are better than others I've bought. It's hit or miss on how well and quickly the screen is able to pick up the sensation. The index and middle finger work much better than the thumb. Still, it usually takes a few attempts at typing or pressing anything before it works, and have to use the very tip of your finger. It can be frustrating. For the price and thickness of the glove itself, not bad
customer_reviews.author: Anya021

customer_reviews.title: Warm Gloves!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for an upcoming trip to Alaska and decided to try them out at my granddaughters softball game at night where the wind blows and the temp is in 50's. Did my hands stay warm - YES they did. I love that these gloves are not bulky but still do the job. Maybe I was not doing it correctly but sadly the touch screen on my phone did not work with the gloves. Not a deal breaker though as they are still going to Alaska with me. I even bought two more pairs for my granddaughters !
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

product_meta.title: Achiou Winter Knit Gloves Touchscreen Warm Thermal Soft Lining Elastic Cuff Texting Anti-Slip 3 Size Choice for Women Men
feature_bullets: COMFORTABLE & WARM – Soft and warm lining design,It's great not having ice cold fingers while texting/typing/writing in cold winter.

TOUCH SENSITIVE & ANTI-SLIP PALM – The Unique and Practical 3 Touchscreen Fingers Capability design(thumb, forefinger ,middle finger), you can use the gloves on all your touch screen devices. The gloves work just like using your fingers. Palm large area triangle silicone non-slip design for driving & phone grip maintain dexterity.

PERFECTLY FITS & BEST GIFTS – This is a high-quality couple gloves, has excellent elasticity, Stretches to fit most hands, You can easily get a custom fit according to your hands. it is best appropriate gift for your lover friends and family etc.

CONVENIENT & BREATHABLE MATERIAL – Living in the technology age, gloves that allow you to utilize your devices without removing them is essential.Breathable material make sure your hands do no sweat while wearing the gloves.

SHOP WITH CONFIDENCE: Each pairs of gloves undergoes strictinspection before leaving the factory. You have no risk to have a try, just need to believe, we will be always with you. Any question, we are willing to try our best to solve it, without any requirement.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
